questions.question: What is the continental shelf?
questions.answer: The continental shelf is the shallow, gently sloping part of the ocean floor near continents.

questions.question: What is the continental slope?
questions.answer: The continental slope is the steep slope that descends from the shelf to the deep ocean floor.

questions.question: What is an abyssal plain?
questions.answer: An abyssal plain is a flat, deep part of the ocean floor.

questions.question: What are mid-ocean ridges?
questions.answer: Mid-ocean ridges are long underwater mountain chains formed by volcanic activity.

questions.question: Why are continental shelves important?
questions.answer: They are important for fishing, oil and natural gas resources.
